recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3231 (Printing): 28,127 establishments = HIGHEST manufacturing fragmentation. Employment declining 6.1%. 85% say AI critical but only 40% adopted. Print-on-demand market $8.3B -> $59.3B by 2033 (27.8% CAGR).
recent_signals.structural_shift: Silver Tsunami + Robotics x AI (Manufacturing Discovery)
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, print industry AI surveys, print-on-demand market projections

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 2382 (Building Equipment Contractors): 2,461,733 employees, 230,398 establishments, $190B total wages. 70% can't find workers. 499K new workers needed in 2026. Wage growth 5.4%/yr. AI data center construction driving demand.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, CSIS skilled trades report, Fortune 499K workers, Google $10M electrician grant

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5613 (Employment Services): 3,567,509 employees, 155,963 establishments, $192.7B wages. Employment DECLINING 7.6%. Active Schumpeterian cascade in staffing industry. AI matching replaces human recruiters.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, staffing industry trends

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5223 (Credit Intermediation Support): Employment declining 10.7% while wages growing 13.8%. Textbook Schumpeterian gap signal. Survivors transitioning to AI-native cost structures.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 6213 (Allied Health Practitioners): 1,158,452 employees, 191,226 establishments = MOST fragmented healthcare sector. Employment growing 6.8%. Fragmentation proxy 0.165 (highest). Underserved by enterprise healthcare IT (Epic, Cerner).
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, practice management software landscape

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3261 (Plastics Products): 599,626 employees, 12,048 establishments, $39.6B wages. Injection molding highly automatable: robotic part removal, AI vision defect detection, ML process parameter optimization.
recent_signals.structural_shift: Silver Tsunami + Robotics x AI (Plastics Discovery)
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, injection molding automation reports, reshoring trends

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3371 (Furniture Manufacturing): 226,685 employees, 12,767 establishments. Kitchen cabinets largest subsegment. Many small shops with CNC routers but no AI. Design-to-CNC AI can reduce programming 80%.
recent_signals.structural_shift: Silver Tsunami + Robotics x AI (Furniture Discovery)
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, housing market data, CNC automation trends

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 6241 (Individual/Family Services): 981,362 establishments = MOST fragmented major industry in the US economy. Elder care coordination, social services, family support. Platform infrastructure opportunity.
recent_signals.structural_shift: Silver Tsunami + Coasean Shrinkage (Elder Care Discovery)
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 6212 (Dental): 1,026,380 employees, 135,236 establishments. 137 PE dental acquisitions in 2024 but saturation emerging. FTC scrutiny. Regulatory backlash via state corporate practice laws. Counter-PE opportunity.
recent_signals.structural_shift: PE Minsky Vulnerability + Baumol Cure (Dental Discovery)
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, PE dental rollup data, FTC enforcement, Archy $20M

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 6216 (Home Health): 1,629,522 employees, 49,400 establishments. Growing elderly population + severe workforce shortage. AI can make each caregiver 30-50% more productive via scheduling/routing/documentation.
recent_signals.structural_shift: Silver Tsunami + Baumol Cure (Home Health Discovery)
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, home health workforce data, Sensi AI, AlayaCare

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5419/541940 (Veterinary): US vet market ~$35B. PE aggressively rolled up but saturation + regulatory backlash. State corporate practice laws. 30% already using AI. Digitail (1000+ hospitals), Shepherd entering.
recent_signals.structural_shift: PE Minsky Vulnerability + Regulatory Fragmentation (Veterinary Discovery)
recent_signals.source: PE veterinary rollup data, state regulatory trends, Digitail/Shepherd

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 6244 (Child Day Care): 954,796 employees, 78,107 establishments. Average pay $31,747 (one of lowest). 50 different state licensing regimes. Brightwheel dominant ($600M+) but AI compliance gap.
recent_signals.structural_shift: Regulatory Fragmentation + Baumol Cure (Child Care Discovery)
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, child care policy, Brightwheel analysis

recent_signals.headline: Stress test: 7 of top 10 C6 models robust across ALL 3 alternative weight vectors. Physical architectures dominate convergence/compounding weights. Data compounding dominates force weights.
recent_signals.source: Internal stress test of C6 top 20 models

recent_signals.headline: Force-architecture matrix: 80 cells mapped. 16 structurally impossible (20%). 12 unexplored-promising (all filled). Baumol cure and Silver Tsunami most versatile forces (8 of 10 architecture types each).
recent_signals.source: Internal matrix analysis of C6+C7 models

recent_signals.headline: CloudNC has 1,000 CNC shops on platform. LimitlessCNC in stealth. Both validate AI in CNC but NEITHER acquires shops. $2.26B Q1 2026 robotics funding. Acquisition model remains uncontested.
recent_signals.source: Web search: CloudNC, LimitlessCNC, Q1 2026 robotics funding

recent_signals.headline: PE veterinary rollups saturating. FTC scrutiny. State corporate practice of veterinary medicine laws emerging. Independent vets seeking alternatives to PE acquisition. 30% already using AI tools.
recent_signals.source: Web search: PE veterinary rollup, FTC, state regulations

recent_signals.headline: ServiceTitan IPO ($9.5B valuation). Serves enterprise contractors. 230K+ small building equipment contractor establishments underserved. AI dispatching + estimating can improve utilization 20-30%.
recent_signals.source: ServiceTitan IPO, NAICS 2382 data, CSIS report

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5222 (Nondepository Credit): Employment declining 9.8%. Mortgage/consumer lending consolidating. Survivors need AI-native cost structures for loan processing, underwriting, compliance.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3323 (Structural Steel/Metal Fab): Employment growing but fragmented ownership. Robotic welding + AI layout optimization proven. Retiring owners in fabrication shops.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3334 (HVAC Equipment): AI data center demand driving need for 40-50kW rack cooling systems. Liquid cooling market exploding. 140K+ skilled trades workers needed by 2030.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW, CSIS data center infrastructure report, hyperscaler capex

recent_signals.headline: LLM inference costs dropped 50x/yr median. GPT-4 equivalent now $0.40/M tokens. Full-service bookkeeping $0.05/client/month. Cost floor effectively zero vs human labor. Every cycle confirms deepening.
recent_signals.source: AI pricing benchmarks, DeepSeek R1, Gemini 2.0

recent_signals.headline: O*NET + BLS: $207B automatable wages across 7 key occupations. Professional services wages STILL growing +4%/yr vs CPI 2.5%. Baumol stored energy continues accumulating.
recent_signals.source: O*NET, BLS May 2024 OEWS

recent_signals.headline: 52.3% of US employer-businesses owned by people 55+. 2.34M businesses, $10T assets. 58% no succession plan. NAICS reveals: printing 28K, plastics 12K, furniture 12.7K, metal fab, plus CNC and food.
recent_signals.source: Census, SBA, BizBuySell, NAICS QCEW

recent_signals.headline: Cobots $25K-60K. ROI 6-18 months. $2.26B Q1 2026 robotics funding. NAICS adds 12+ sectors for deployment: printing, plastics (robotic part removal), furniture (design-to-CNC), auto parts, foundry, coating.
recent_signals.structural_shift: Robotics x AI + NAICS Sector Expansion
recent_signals.source: UR, Standard Bots, FANUC, Deloitte, NAICS QCEW

recent_signals.headline: 250+ AI healthcare bills. 33 laws. NAIC model law. FSMA 204 enforcement 2026. NEW C7: veterinary state regulations, child care 50-state licensing, construction permitting, dental FTC, financial AI compliance.
recent_signals.source: State legislatures, NAIC, CMS, FDA, FTC, NAICS QCEW

recent_signals.headline: $1.2T PE debt maturing 2027-2029. PE distress now visible beyond accounting: veterinary (saturation + FTC), dental (137 deals 2024 but returns compressing), staffing (-7.6%), printing (digital decline).
recent_signals.source: PitchBook, FTC, NAICS employment trends

recent_signals.headline: SBA waived ALL 504 loan fees for manufacturers through Sept 30, 2026. Extends to print shops, plastics, furniture, metal fab -- all NAICS 31-33. TIME-SENSITIVE. 0% upfront, 0% annual.
recent_signals.source: SBA, CDC lending programs

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3391 (Medical Device Manufacturing): 14,157 establishments. FDA QSR compliance creates massive regulatory moat. AI quality control + robotic assembly for contract manufacturing.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW, FDA QSR requirements

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5414 (Specialized Design): 47,660 establishments, highest fragmentation in professional services. AI design tools mature. AI-first design agency replacing traditional firms at 5-10x lower cost.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5416 (Management Consulting): 394,824 establishments, $175B wages. AI can generate consulting deliverables (analysis, strategy, process optimization) at 10x lower cost. 4.2% wage growth.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 4841 (General Freight Trucking): 127,018 establishments. Fragmented owner-operator market. AI dispatch + route optimization can improve load utilization 15-25%. Autonomous trucking still 5+ years out for last mile.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW, trucking industry data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5312 (Real Estate Activities): 163,010 establishments, employment declining 5.2%. AI transaction coordination replacing manual processes. But: $10.5B funded in real estate AI -- only specific niches viable.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5221 (Banking): 89,587 establishments, stable employment. Community banks need AI back-office but procurement cycles long. Opportunity exists but requires patient go-to-market.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 6233 (Assisted Living + Residential Care): 29K facilities. Growing elderly population. Staffing crisis. AI care coordination, medication management, family communication. Moderate convergence resistance.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5418 (Advertising): AI can generate campaigns, optimize placement, and produce reports at 5x lower cost. Traditional ad agencies under margin pressure. Fragmented market of small agencies.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: Printing industry AI adoption jumped from 24.7% to 40% in one year. 85% believe AI critical for competitiveness. But 60% still haven't adopted. AI workflow automation, variable data printing, predictive maintenance.
recent_signals.source: Web search: print industry AI adoption surveys

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3115 (Dairy): Artisan cheese/specialty dairy growing. AI process control for fermentation, predictive maintenance for refrigeration. Specialty segments with 20-30% margins viable.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3328 (Coating/Heat Treating): Specialty surface treatment facilities with AI process optimization + vision QC. Environmental permits create regulatory moat.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3363 (Auto Parts): Tier 2/3 suppliers with retiring owners. AI quality inspection + predictive maintenance. Reshoring tailwinds. OEM compliance requirements create barrier.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data, reshoring data

recent_signals.headline: Global bakery market $504B growing to $731B by 2032. IBIE 2025 showcased AI ovens, decorating robots, compact automation. Food automation growing 8.3% CAGR to $20.35B by 2031.
recent_signals.source: Web search: bakery automation 2025-2026, IBIE, food automation market

recent_signals.headline: AI-powered freight and trucking: autonomous last-mile 5+ years out, but AI dispatch and route optimization NOW. Convoy failed ($3.8B valuation) but Flexport, Uber Freight operating. Owner-operators underserved.
recent_signals.source: Web search: AI freight trucking logistics 2025-2026

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3113 (Confectionery): Specialty candy/chocolate with brand equity. AI tempering, robotic molding/packaging. Family-owned companies with artisan positioning viable for acquisition.

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3256 (Cosmetics/Personal Care Manufacturing): DTC beauty brand proliferation creating demand for AI-native contract manufacturing. FDA compliance automation.

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 4251 (Wholesale Trade Brokers): 122K establishments, employment declining. AI matching + logistics replacing human brokers. Coasean shrinkage in wholesale intermediation.

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 6231 (Skilled Nursing Facilities): Staffing crisis. AI can optimize staffing schedules, automate clinical documentation, manage medication, ensure compliance. Growing demand from aging population.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3121 (Beverages): Craft brewery/distillery market consolidating. AI fermentation monitoring, QC, packaging optimization. Contract production opportunity for craft brands.

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 5413 (Engineering Services): 167K establishments, $181B wages, 4.3% wage growth. AI-powered engineering analysis at 5x lower cost. But high judgment/tacit knowledge component limits full automation.

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 3315 (Foundries): 1,689 establishments. Specialty foundries (aluminum, iron, steel casting) with AI pour optimization + robotic finishing. Niche but high convergence resistance.
recent_signals.source: NAICS QCEW 4-digit data

recent_signals.headline: FINANCIAL CASCADE CONFIRMED: BLS accounting employment DOWN 49K YoY. FRED business loan delinquency rising to 1.78%. YFinance financials ETF dead last at +0.5%. EDGAR 10K+ restructuring filings. 7 independent data sources confirm active Schumpeterian destruction in financial services.
recent_signals.source: FRED (DRSFRMACBS, FEDFUNDS), BLS (CES6500000001), YFinance (XLF), EDGAR (restructuring filings), Census CBP (NAICS 54)

recent_signals.headline: STAFFING CANARY CRASH: Robert Half -53.1%, ManpowerGroup -43.9%, Kelly Services -25.4% in one year. STRONGEST real-time market signal in entire dataset. Markets pricing in structural destruction of traditional staffing. BLS already confirmed -7.6% employment decline in NAICS 5613.
recent_signals.structural_shift: Staffing Industry Active Destruction (NEW PATTERN P-027)
recent_signals.source: YFinance (RHI, MAN, KELYA), BLS (NAICS 5613 employment), QCEW (3.57M employees, $192.7B wages)

recent_signals.headline: PHYSICAL PRODUCTION CAPITAL FLOWS CONFIRMED: Industrials ETF +15.1%, Materials ETF +20.1%, Energy +29.9% (6mo performance). Capital decisively flowing into physical/production sectors. Manufacturing/acquire-and-modernize thesis validated by real-time market data.

recent_signals.headline: ZERO-DENSITY GAPS VALIDATED: Web search confirms ZERO funded AI startups in wholesale distribution, commercial printing, and specialty food production. These are the deepest Schumpeterian gaps â€” strong structural forces but no AI entrepreneurs have noticed them.

recent_signals.headline: AUTO REPAIR COMPETITIVE DENSITY WARNING: Revv raised $20M for AI auto repair. ADAS diagnostics provider funded $20M+. Total 5 funded competitors found. Zero-density assumption INVALIDATED. Auto repair models downgraded -4 each.
recent_signals.source: WebSearch (auto repair AI startup funding), cross-referenced with pre-cycle 8 assumptions

recent_signals.headline: AI INFRASTRUCTURE CAPEX PEAKING: NVIDIA flat (+3.7%), Microsoft DOWN (-23.6%) in 6 months. Kondratieff deployment phase: infrastructure buildout peaking, application deployment beginning. Application-layer businesses (all our models) benefit from cheaper compute and less infrastructure competition.
recent_signals.source: YFinance (NVDA, MSFT, GOOG), cross-referenced with Goldman $527B AI capex estimate

recent_signals.headline: COASEAN SHRINKAGE CONFIRMED: Business applications 532K/month (FRED) despite rising delinquency (1.78%). Old businesses dying, new AI-native micro-firms forming. Validates demand for AI-powered business services infrastructure (financial intelligence, compliance, staffing).
recent_signals.source: FRED (BABATOTALSAUS business applications, DRSFRMACBS delinquency)
